io.elegie.luchess.core.domain.entities

Class Move

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.elegie.luchess.core.domain.entities.Move
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractMove

    public abstract class Move
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a move by a player, such as 'e4'. Implementations are expected to provide the algorithm to effectively apply a move on a given Position , for a target Color.

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public abstract void apply(Color color,
         Position position)
                    throws IllegalMoveException
        Plays the move on a given Position, for a certain Color. Note that in the PGN specification, the color is not indicated in the move itself, but rather derived from the sequence of moves (White being the first one to play). Given an immutable move, implementations should make sure that this method remains thread-safe. In other words, the same move object should be concurrently applicable to different positions.
        Parameters:
        color - Color of the player playing the move.
        position - Position upon which the move is played.
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveException - When the current position does not allow the move. For instance, the move may refer to some invalid square (e.g. an empty square, while we would expect to find the piece we want to move or capture).

      • canApply

        public abstract boolean canApply(Color color,
               Position position)
        Checks whether a move can be played on a given position, for a given Color.
        Parameters:
        color - Color of the player about to play the move.
        position - Position upon which the move should be played.
        Returns:
        True when the move can safely be applied, false otherwise. Further trying to apply a move upon a position which does not allow it will generate a IllegalMoveException.

      • getValue

        public abstract java.lang.String getValue()
        Returns:
        The text representation of the Move. We use the PGN convention.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
